_header: Full oft I muse and has in thought
_description: William Dunbar, ‘Best to be blyth’ — eight 5-line stanzas with refrain, ‘ffor to be blyth me think it best’

CULLl510.First Lines:
Full oft I muse and hes in thochtHow þis fals warld is ay on
                    flocht…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…To pas out of þis fraufull farieffor to be blyth me
                    think it best

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Full oft I mvse and hes in thochthow þis fals warld is ay on
                    flocht…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…To pas out of þis fraudfull farieffor to be blyth me
                    think it best
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Small,  John, Ae. James George Mackay,  George Powell McNeill,   and  Walter Gregor, eds.  
             The Poems of William Dunbar.
             5 pts. 
             Scottish Text Society
         2, 4, 16, 21, 29. Edinburgh, 1884-93: 2.110-11.
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.410-11.

Banna.First Lines:
ffull oft I muse And hes in thochthow this fals warld is ay on
                    flocht…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Na tyme bot turne can tak restffor quhais fals
                    change…
Banna.Note: Lines 1-9 only; second occurrence in MS.

Fox,  Denton,  and  William A. Ringler.
